title: Am I in the wrong here?
body: Hi, I just played a game with a person who was autofilled support, than proceeded to take smite and steal every single one of my camps. At that point, my team and I came to the conciseness that the game was over, so I decided to start a dance party at dragon and not jungle anymore because i physically could not, as the kayle "support" kept smiting all the camps I tried to take. The rest of my team seemed fine with this, and agreed that the game was over, but I just want to make sure that I'm not in the wrong here. This is my first experience with a person straight out inting, and I ended up getting demoted after :/

replies.body: The game is not over when one person is unable to contribute. But when all 5 do so, then it's over. If you did not give up, you might have realized that you could collect XP from the bot lane, by simply "supporting" the adc. Then eventually roam, then pressure objectives with your smite. This doesn't mean the Kayle was right, she was definitely in the wrong, and you certainly all should have reported her. But by stopping playing the game, the entire rest of the team was also wrong, and threw away an admittedly slight, but still existing chance that you could have won.

hello friend, 

it takes a significant number of regular reports to result in punishing actions. if your get chat restriction or something along that line, then you know that you are often getting reported

in that game you explained - I personally would have tried to get you encouraged to play again. it's a sucky situation and about one in 20 of them are actually recoverable. but it is such a hard place to be in. personally, I likely would not have reported you at all - tho some times, due to some situations which I don't feel you described here, such an afk'er is also someone I report - but as you explain it I don't think yours would've been that situation. as you described it, I wouldn't have reported you at all. 

If you find yourself regularly behaving in this way, then try to slowly train yourself into the habit of keeping cool under pressure. it's a good life skill tbh. 

was what you did "wrong?" friend - what is right and wrong depends on who is judging you. that is all there is. whether that person is yourself, a friend, an enemy, the police, a starving family stealing bread - all these things change the "rules" about right verse wrong. find confidence in yourself - that is what is right for you! if dancing in baron pit in unwinnable games is right for you so be it. personally, I try not to do that, but as I said. if that is what works for you, then that is what works for you.

You were in the wrong.  Always try to win the game even if it seems hopeless.  You don't do it for the 90 games you lose anyway. You do it for the 10 you pull out of your rump and steal.
Why didn't you dodge when you saw her taking smite?

My mind kind of just wandered off, I forgot what I was doing (probably watching a video in another tab or something) usually I don't pay attention to the draft. She might have locked in smite at the last second, because she originally had exhaust flash. It was only when she started following me around in the jungle that I realized her intentions. I looked at this person's match history, and it looks like they've done the same thing in the past to other people. I just received word today that they were punished though, so I hope they stop.
Oh that's good but it's very important to pay attention to the champion selection.

this is why autofill is cancer

riot just doesnt listen though :/

I know it's hard to deal with people like this, but trust me, report them. Most likely they've already been reported by other people in different games. And they will get banned eventually and out of the community. The worst thing you can do is flame too (dragon dance). 
I'm sorry this happened to you but please, don't follow their example. Keep a positive mind always and you will climb! 

Best of luck in your future games! :D

That's one of the most frustrating things to happen to a jg. Unfortunately, dancing at dragon is still going afk, so Leavebuster could give you an automatic penalty, or since Riot upgraded the griefing detection recently, it could give you a 14 day ban if you were reported that game.

If your team agrees to give up, FF at 20 (since the ff at 15 wouldn't work with a troll). Or you can use the game as practice at 50/50 smites. Smite also has a cd, so you should still have access to enough cs that you're not completely useless that game.
you should be banned. you stopped trying to dance at dragon.
